intro: Acronia tryssa, commonly known as the narrowleaf acronia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Acronia tryssa is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and woodland edges. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
